name: Topics in Modern Arabic Language,Literature & Culture: Cinema in the Arab World
base_name: Topics in Modern Arabic Language,Literature & Culture: Cinema in the Arab World
long_desc: Through an exploration of contemporary Arab cinema, this course will introducestudents to issues in modern Arab societies that represent the diversity of theregion as well as shared aspirations and challenges. We will explore how Arabfilmmakers represent social, political, and economic changes and realities. We willanalyze select movies, including their cultural and historical background, as wellas relevant written and audiovisual materials from different media sources andliterary texts as appropriate. Some topics include nationalism and nationalidentitys, womens issues, diversity in the region, religious and political strife,social and economic challenges, and the recent revolts. This course also aims toadvance students competence in the Arabic language while considering thechanging sociolinguistic and sociocultural landscape in the Arab world. In ourwork with course materials, we will employ linguistic and paralinguistic analysesof the movies as a means to explore modern Arab thought and cultures.

custom_fields.goals: Enhance students knowledge and understanding of select social, cultural,political, and economic realities in Arab societies and their historical roots,as well as debates that currently engage Arab thought and cultures. Enhance students appreciation of the discussed issues from a humanisticperspective. Develop students Arabic competence and abilities to communicateeffectively in Arabic, including in academic writing and speech in anintegrated skills format. Develop an ear for different Arabic varieties while enhancing studentsknowledge of Modern Standard Arabic. Develop students abilities to argue, debate, and present persuasivearguments in writing and in speech. Develop students analytical abilities and critical thinking.
custom_fields.key_topics:
Through an exploration of contemporary Arab cinema, this course will introduce
students to issues in modern Arab societies that represent the diversity of the
region as well as shared aspirations and challenges. We will explore how Arab
filmmakers represent social, political, and economic changes and realities. We will
analyze select movies, including their cultural and historical background, as well
as relevant written and audiovisual materials from different media sources and
literary texts (as appropriate). Some topics include nationalism and national
identity(s), women's issues, diversity in the region, religious and political strife,
social and economic challenges, and the recent revolts. This course also aims to
advance students' competence in the Arabic language while considering the
changing sociolinguistic and sociocultural landscape in the Arab world. In our
work with course materials, we will employ linguistic and paralinguistic analyses
of the movies as a means to explore modern Arab thought and cultures.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge:
Students are expected to have advanced knowledge in the Arabic language to
better understand assigned materials and effectively take part in class
discussions.
custom_fields.relevance:
Within an overall focus on advancing competence in the Arabic language, the
course seeks to enhance students' knowledge and understanding of issues and
debates that currently engage Arab thought, communities, and cultures within a
changing sociolinguistic and sociocultural landscape. It aims to help students
better understand and appreciate issues that impact Arab and Arabic-speaking

communities, while developing a humanistic understanding of issues in ways that
develop intercultural understanding.
